meta_description: Current exhibitions, construction updates, and news at Glenbow
hours_text:
## Closure & Reopening

Glenbow is currently closed for renovations as we transform the museum through [_Glenbow Reimagined_](http://web.archive.org/web/20251107181508/https://www.glenbow.org/renovation/), our campaign to deliver a revitalized museum with you — our community — at its core.

Glenbow will reopen in its renovated home, the JR Shaw Centre for Arts & Culture, in 2026. We look forward to welcoming you back!

## Glenbow at The Edison is Now Closed

Glenbow’s temporary satellite gallery, Glenbow at The Edison, is now closed as our team focuses on developing over 50 new spaces in Glenbow’s reimagined home, the JR Shaw Centre for Arts & Culture. Thank you to the more than 64,000 people who visited 10 wonderful exhibitions in this special gallery.

Glenbow at The Edison was made possible with generous support from Mobsquad. Thank you to the Calgary Downtown Association and Calgary Foundation for supporting free admission for all visitors.

## How to Visit Belongings

If your community has belongings stewarded by Glenbow that you would like to visit, please contact us at [collections@glenbow.org](http://web.archive.org/web/20251107181508/mailto:collections@glenbow.org).

Please note Glenbow is currently under construction as we transform the museum through the [_Glenbow Reimagined_](http://web.archive.org/web/20251107181508/https://www.glenbow.org/renovation/) project. Because of this, access to collections involves passing through an active construction environment.

## Make Your Gift

Art is for everyone. This simple belief is a driving force behind _Glenbow Reimagined_ , our campaign to deliver a revitalized museum at the JR Shaw Centre for Arts & Culture with you — our community — at its core.

**Be part of our exciting future by making a gift today.**

[Donate now](http://web.archive.org/web/20260113172011/https://www.glenbow.org/donate/)

## Latest on the blog

Venture deeper into Glenbow and explore arts, culture, history, and more. Stay up to date on our latest transformation updates and all the latest news.

[Explore the blog](http://web.archive.org/web/20260113172011/https://www.glenbow.org/blog/)

#### Artist Feature: Greg Payce

##### 

One of the most celebrated ceramic artists in Canada today, Greg Payce is known for remarkable vases and vessels. In our latest artist feature, learn how his inventive practice engages with the history of clay.
